title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are in a better position to acquire key players this offseason.
Boston made the playoffs in 2025 but faces possible departures of Alex Bregman, Lucas Giolito, and Trevor Story.
Red Sox have about $25 million under the luxury tax and a strong farm system to improve the roster.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots head coach, insists recent changes aren't to distance from team's past success.
Vrabel altered Patriots traditions by introducing offensive starters individually, ending a 24-year-old tradition.
Despite the changes, Patriots lead AFC East with a 6-2 record at season's halfway point.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm to miss a few weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained in a game against the Sabres.
Bruins' Marat Khusnutdinov promoted to the first-line center position between David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm scored four power play goals and nine points over 12 games before his injury.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Salem, Massachusetts, saw large crowds and vibrant costumes throughout Essex Street on Halloween 2025.
Festivities included street performances, markets, and decorated venues, drawing tourists to Salem's historic sites.
Salem Common hosted activities like a Witches' Circle, with trick-or-treating, food trucks, and music.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Donald Trump of abusing young girls with Jeffrey Epstein, offering no proof.
During a tense MSNBC exchange, Moulton claimed Trump is 'in the Epstein files' and criticized Republicans' working-class stance.
Host Joe Scarborough interrupted Moulton, citing lack of evidence, and emphasized other issues to discuss around Trump.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's murder trial is scheduled for jury selection starting Nov. 18, aiming to conclude by Christmas.
A judge ordered the preservation of key cellphone evidence related to Michael Proctor for Brian Walshe's defense.
Prosecutors revealed sensitive content on Proctor's cellphone, while defense attorneys seek more material to aid the case.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market in Newton reopened after a three-day closure due to asbestos concerns in a stockroom.
MassDEP confirmed the asbestos was contained, and air samples showed no asbestos risk to shoppers.
Asbestos abatement in the stockroom will continue safely without posing a public risk.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace for 57 goals this season with the Boston Bruins, showcasing an impressive goal-scoring ability.
Geekie's shooting prowess has been highlighted by the NHL's fastest shot this season, a 95.68 mph goal against Ilya Sorokin.
Increased power-play utilization under new coach Steve Spott has contributed to Geekie's scoring surge, with two power-play goals this season.

title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics exercised $2.74 million team option on Baylor Scheierman for the 2026-27 season.
Scheierman was the 30th pick in the 2024 NBA Draft, averaging 18.5 points as a senior at Creighton.
In limited NBA action, Scheierman has averaged 8.5 minutes and 3 points per game this season.

title: Keion White admits he wasn’t fit for Patriots’ scheme, while 49ers want to tap into ‘limitless potential’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Keion White was traded from the New England Patriots to the San Francisco 49ers for a sixth-round pick.
White struggled with the Patriots' defensive scheme, reducing his playing time and leading to his trade.
49ers see potential in White's inside pass-rushing ability, viewing him as a versatile asset for their defense.
